;

;On Friday, September 15, 2023, after the stock market closed, the China Securities Regulatory Commission announced: Nanjing I The major shareholder of Le Home Co., Ltd. (Wo Le Home) imposed heavy penalties. On the same day, another listed company, Oriental Fashion, announced that its chairman and actual controller had been arrested on suspicion of manipulating the securities market. Shareholders of the two companies who illegally reduced their holdings were severely fined, which shows that the regulatory authorities are serious about illegal reductions and other behaviors.

;

;The China Securities Regulatory Commission website reported on September 15 that the major shareholder Yu Fanyi, who holds 7.11% of the shares of Wole Home, and his concerted parties have illegally reduced their holdings of Wole Home shares and plan to confiscate them in accordance with the law. Those acting in concert had illegal gains of 16.53 million yuan and were severely fined 32.95 million yuan, with a total fine of 49.48 million yuan. According to the report, Yu Fanyi and his concerted parties failed to fulfill their information disclosure obligations in accordance with the law when they purchased 5% of Wole Home's shares through the secondary market in 2021 and were warned. This time, Yu Fanyi and others reduced all 7.11% of their stock holdings on September 5 and 6, 2023, once again violating the regulations that should be announced when the change in shareholding ratio reaches 5% and must not be announced within 3 days. Rules for buying and selling the stock again. In response, the China Securities Regulatory Commission decided to impose heavy penalties.

;

;The Securities Law stipulates a number of special provisions for shareholders who hold (including jointly held through persons acting in concert) more than 5% of the shares of a listed company when buying and selling stocks: when the shareholding reaches 5%, the stock purchase and sale period shall be within 3 days. A written report shall be made to the Securities Regulatory Commission and the stock exchange, and the listed company shall be notified to make an announcement. During this period, the listed company's stocks shall not be traded again; thereafter, a report and announcement shall be made for every increase or decrease of 5%, and no further purchases shall be made within 3 days after the announcement. Buy and sell the company's stocks; after the shareholding reaches 5%, every time the shareholding increases or decreases by 1%, the listed company should be notified and announced on the next day. These regulations are made because shareholders holding more than 5% of the shares are considered important shareholders, and their stock buying and selling behavior may have an important impact on the company's stock price and affect the rights and interests of other small shareholders, so they need to be disclosed in a timely manner.

;

;The purpose of establishing the stock market is to allow listed companies to obtain the funds needed for business development, while also providing investors with the opportunity to share the company's future earnings. There are usually two ways for listed companies to create value for investors, one is to increase the stock price, and the other is to pay cash dividends. However, the stock prices of many A-share listed companies have fallen below the issue price (breaking the issue), which means that the stock prices have not risen since listing, but have fallen. Although it cannot be ruled out that some investors have made profits during the rise and fall process, but Overall, investors lost money. According to statistics from Jiemian News, as of the close of trading on September 6, 2023, 758 A-share listed companies had broken their shares, accounting for a large proportion of the more than 5,000 listed companies.

;

;Let’s look at dividends. According to data from the China Association of Public Companies, since the establishment of the capital market, the total cumulative cash dividends of all listed companies is less than 16 trillion yuan, while the total equity financing, including initial offerings and refinancing, has reached 18 trillion yuan. The total amount of cash dividends is not as large as the total amount of financing. In other words, overall, Chinese stock market investors are still giving blood to listed companies without getting enough returns.

;

;It is in this investment environment that the controlling shareholders and actual controllers of listed companies have repeatedly cashed out large amounts of money by reducing their holdings of the company's stocks, cutting off the rights of small and medium-sized shareholders. This is almost a chronic disease of A-shares, which has attracted investors' attention. Criticize. The purpose of listing many A-share companies is to make money. The major shareholders and actual controllers have never thought about creating value for investors. Some companies used financial fraud and other means to pass the listing review and raise the issuance price at the beginning of their listing. After listing, they seized every opportunity to cash out, either through reduction of holdings, or through mortgage stock loans, and some refinanced again. Make money from the stock market. It is for this reason (and of course because of long-standing illegal phenomena such as information disclosure violations and stock price manipulation) that the A-share market is called a "leek harvester" and "speculative market" by some investors.

;

;These unreasonable phenomena in the stock market have seriously harmed the interests of investors, especially small and medium-sized investors, and also undermined investor confidence. The recent downward trend of the A-share market is closely related to investors' lack of confidence.

;

;In order to rectify the problem of large shareholders infringing on the interests of small and medium-sized shareholders, the China Securities Regulatory Commission recently promulgated new regulations "Further Regulating Share Reduction Behavior", which requires listed companies to have broken shares or net losses, or have not made any cash in the past three years. If the amount of dividends and accumulated cash dividends is less than 30% of the average annual net profit in the past three years, the controlling shareholder or actual controller is not allowed to reduce the company's shares through the secondary market. That is to say, if a listed company does not create enough value for secondary market investors, its controlling shareholders, actual controllers, etc. are not allowed to realize it by reducing their holdings.

;

;The original intention of the new regulations is good, but the key is whether they can be implemented. Therefore, this time when shareholders of listed companies such as Wole Home Furnishing and Oriental Fashion illegally reduced their holdings, investors were waiting to see how the regulatory authorities would punish them. If the exchanges continue to lightly “condemn” and “warn” as before without substantive penalties, then the new regulations will obviously not have much deterrence.

;

;Fortunately, judging from the recently announced processing progress, the regulatory authorities are obviously serious this time: the major shareholders of Wolejia were confiscated and imposed huge fines on their illegal reduction of holdings, basically spitting out All proceeds from the shareholding reduction (including the proceeds from the legal shareholding reduction); and the chairman of Oriental Fashion was found to have other behaviors of manipulating stock prices and will be held criminally responsible. Vigorous enforcement of laws is undoubtedly of great significance in boosting market confidence.

;

;However, restricting major shareholders and actual controllers of listed companies from reducing their holdings only blocks one way for them to realize cash. To make the capital market truly a win-win market for investors and listed companies, and to prevent listing from becoming a way for major shareholders and actual controllers to cut off leeks, more measures are needed to make it more difficult for major shareholders and actual controllers to collect money and realize cash from the stock market. .

;

;For example, new regulations issued by the exchange in February 2023 allow restricted shares to be loaned through refinancing channels. Some people believe that this allows strategic investors to reduce their holdings in disguised form through this mechanism, which may lead to issues such as fairness and institutional consistency. Jindi shares, which was recently listed, sold more than 4.5 million shares (equivalent to short selling) on ​​the first day of listing, with an amount of up to 220 million yuan. These securities were suspected to come from "strategic investors" such as company executives and core employees. Restricted shares held. Previously, there were cases where "strategic investors" lent large sums of restricted shares on the first day of a company's listing and sold them through securities lending. Whether this involves executives of listed companies "short selling" their own stocks to lock in profits on the first day of listing, and whether it will harm the interests of secondary market investors, is worthy of concern.

; Mon, 18 Sep 2023 16:25:03 +0800 卖惨打造“大凉山人设”卖假货，水军团伙落网http://www.infzm.com/contents/256900

;

;Exciting and tense music

;

;"Hot-selling" products that are only available for ten seconds;

;The quality is "superior"

;

;Coupled with the tempting comments from "old fans" that flood the screen

;

;How many people have experienced this kind of live broadcast to bring goods?

;

;Be careful of falling into the trap of "Internet trolls"!

;

;September 14 is the Rule of Law Day of the 2023 National Cyber ​​Security Publicity Week. The Sichuan Public Security Bureau held a press conference with the theme of "Maintaining a Clear Cyberspace and Punishing Cyber ​​Chaos" to inform the province. The public security organs work on cracking down on cyber trolls, cyber criminals, cyber hackers, cyber intrusions and other cyber chaos, and publish relevant typical cases. Among them, the Liangshan Public Security Bureau investigated a case in which an Internet celebrity anchor was created to sell miserable products, staged false images of poverty to attract traffic, hired "internet trolls" to increase followers and attract traffic, and used the traffic to sell counterfeit agricultural and sideline products.

;

;;

;

;Basic case< /h4>;

;Since June this year, the Liangshan Internet Security Department has discovered illegal and criminal cases involving false propaganda by "Internet celebrities" and selling counterfeit products for profit. Cooperate with institutions, use "helping farmers" as a gimmick, pretend to be ordinary consumers on short videos and e-commerce platforms, follow the established rhetoric in the "Internet celebrity" live broadcast room, follow, comment, and reply, and cooperate with "Internet celebrities" to create "Daliangshan" "Original" character design, selling fake "specialty agricultural products".

;

;After investigation, in order to cooperate with the false propaganda of "Internet celebrities" in the live broadcast room, MCN agencies approached a media company in Baoding, Hebei, and Xu in Beijing and other Internet troll gangs to carry out "export" business. The media company used more than 1,000 business licenses to register advertising accounts on the short video platform, adding 1,000 followers at a price of 100 to 160 yuan, and increasing followers for Internet celebrities in the live broadcast room. Xu received orders through a professional platform and sent them to "computer rooms" in various places to control robot accounts in batches. He disguised himself as a consumer and commented on the origin of the goods and exaggerated the efficacy of the products during the live broadcast, allowing Internet celebrity anchors to post "helping farmers" in a short time. , public welfare and other labels. Through the "streaming" platform, MCN organizations accurately push Internet celebrities to netizens with relevant interests, suitable age groups, and specific areas to achieve the purpose of increasing fans and attracting traffic, creating the illusion of hot products and grabbing orders, and inducing consumers to buy product.

;

;The online troll gang mainly has the following characteristics:

;

;01

;

;Tightly organized

;

;Through field visits to local people and investigation After conducting in-depth investigations by collecting network information and identifying live broadcast gangs, we found that Internet celebrity anchors performed on the front end and troll gangs diverted traffic behind the scenes, forming an industrialized operation model of "attracting fans, diverting traffic, bringing goods, and monetizing".

;

;02

;

;Highly confusing

;

;MCN organization specializes in collecting classic scripts, professionally staged shots, and employs Internet trolls to heighten the atmosphere. What is presented to netizens is Internet celebrities' hard lives and "inspirational" stories of getting rich with goods are used to gain traffic and consume the goodwill of netizens, and then manufacture and sell fake products in pursuit of profit, making it difficult for netizens to tell the truth from the fake.

;

;03

;

;The area involved in the case is wide

;

;Internet troll gangs are distributed across the country, involving Liangshan, Chengdu, Nanjing, Guangzhou and other places. Each gang uses the Internet to Communication tools serve as link bridges. They do not know each other's true identities, operate independently, and have obvious decentralization characteristics. The total amount of counterfeit "specialty agricultural products" sold by the Internet celebrity involved in the live broadcast reached more than 20 million yuan, and the products were shipped to all parts of the country, seriously infringing on the economic order of the online market and the legitimate rights and interests of consumers.

;

;So far, the Liangshan Internet Security Department has destroyed 3 "cyber troll" companies and arrested 52 suspects, including 2 Internet celebrity anchors, 2 MCN organization members, and 2 supply chain leaders. people. Five online media companies with false propaganda were eliminated, 12 e-commerce platform supply stores were shut down, 13 companies involved in the case were seized, 4 “machine rooms” used to control the volume of live streaming platforms were destroyed, more than 400 mobile phones involved in the case were seized, and 1,500 virtual accounts involved in the case were blocked. More than 5 million yuan of funds involved in the case were frozen.
